description: Absolute values between digits of primes.
comments: a(n) = absolute difference between the first digit of prime(n) and the sum of the other digits of prime (n). [Harvey P. Dale, Mar 11 2012]
links: James Spahlinger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If decimal expansion of n-th prime is x1 x2 x3......xk then a(n)=|x1-x2-x3.......-xk|a(n) = A040997(A000040(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 10 2012
author: _Felice Russo_
